isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING COMPRESSOR AND CLUTCH, TWO CYLINDER RECIPROCATING TYPE - After 01/01/1993 (R-134a) - REMOVE AND INSTALL - COMPRESSOR

important.para: The fittings on the service hoses for R-134a air conditioning systems are standard Metric SAE quick connect fittings that will work only on R-134a air conditioning systems service ports.

step1.para: Remove the protection caps from both service ports.
Connect the recovery/recycling station hoses to the service ports, making sure that the hand valves on the recovery/ recycling station are fully closed by turning them clockwise.
Start with the blue manifold suction hose and connect it to the compressor suction (low pressure) service port. Connect the red hose to the high pressure discharge service port.
Turn the Metric SAE quick-connect valves on the red and blue hoses completely off (turn clockwise).

note.para: Service ports are usually marked on the compressor head. If the marking is not visible, you can identify the suction (low pressure) side by the larger diameter system hose connected to the compressor.

step1.para: DO NOT OPEN the valves on the Metric SAE quick connect fittings until they are connected to the service ports on a vehicle.
Turn the Metric SAE quick-connect valves on the red and blue hoses completely on (turn counterclockwise).

Open both valves of the recovery/ recycling station. Turn the main power switch on and press the compressor start switch. The recovery/recycling Station will automatically shut off when the refrigerant in the system has been exhausted to the storage tank.

After the recovery/recycling station has shut off, close both valves on the recovery/recycling station and on the metric SAE quick connect fittings at the compressor. Remove the blue and red hoses from the service ports on the compressor.
Disconnect the high and low pressure hoses from the compressor. Cap the end of both lines to keep foreign material and moisture from entering the system.
Slack off on the belt tensioner and remove the compressor drive belt. Disconnect the clutch electrical connector.
Remove the four (4) bolts that secure the compressor to its bracket and remove the compressor from the vehicle.

important.para: When removing compressor, be certain to seal all openings to prevent entry of dirt and moisture.

caution.para: Do not invert the compressor beyond a horizontal position during compressor removal or installation as refrigerant oil will leak into the suction cavity. This will result in the piston drawing the oil into the cylinder and damaging the compressor during initial operation after installation.

note.para: Not all parts of the compressor are serviceable. The clutch assembly is replaced as a unit and the compressor seal and valve assemblies are supplied as service kits. More extensive service requirements may necessitate replacement of the compressor.

step1.para: Position the compressor on the mounting bracket and insert the four mounting bolts.
Install the compressor drive belt, align the clutch drive pulley with the accessory drive pulley or water pump pulley and tension the belt as specified in SPECIFICATIONS.
Tighten the compressor mounting bolts to 20 to 25 ft-lbs. (27 to 34 N·m) and install supporting braces if applicable.
Re-install the low and high pressure hoses to the top of the compressor. Be sure to use new O-rings, lubricated in mineral oil.
Recharge the air conditioning system as specified in GROUP 16 - AIR CONDITIONING THEORY, DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
